headline: Brown & Brown Beats Earnings Sending Shares Higher
summary: Brown & Brown (NYSE: BRO) beat both earnings and revenue expectations in Q3, delivering adjusted diluted EPS of $1.05 against a $0.93 estimate and revenue of $1.606 billion versus $1.539 billion expected. The stock is trading $89.99 after-hours, though the company has spent much of the year struggling. This earnings beat arrives as the stock ... Brown & Brown Beats Earnings Sending Shares Higher

headline: Brown & Brown (BRO) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Brown & Brown (BRO) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +16.67% and +6.61%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

raw.headline: Brown & Brown (BRO) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
raw.summary: Brown & Brown (BRO) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +16.67% and +6.61%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Brown & Brown: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Daytona Beach, Florida-based company said it had net income of 68 cents. Earnings, adjusted for amortization costs and costs related to mergers and acquisitions, were $1.05 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: Brown & Brown: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the Daytona Beach, Florida-based company said it had net income of 68 cents. Earnings, adjusted for amortization costs and costs related to mergers and acquisitions, were $1.05 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Brown & Brown, Inc. announces third quarter 2025 results, including total revenues of $1.6 billion, an increase of 35.4%; Organic Revenue growth of 3.5%; diluted net income per share of $0.68; and Diluted Net Income Per Share - Adjusted of $1.05
summary: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Oct. 27, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brown & Brown, Inc. (NYSE:BRO) (the "Company") announced its unaudited financial results for the third quarter of 2025. Revenues for the third quarter of 2025 under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP") were $1.6 billion, increasing $420 million, or 35.4%, compared to the third quarter of the prior year, with commissions and fees increasing by 34.2% and Organic Revenue increasing by 3.5%. Income before income taxes was $311

raw.headline: Brown & Brown, Inc. announces third quarter 2025 results, including total revenues of $1.6 billion, an increase of 35.4%; Organic Revenue growth of 3.5%; diluted net income per share of $0.68; and Diluted Net Income Per Share - Adjusted of $1.05
raw.summary: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Oct. 27, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brown & Brown, Inc. (NYSE:BRO) (the "Company") announced its unaudited financial results for the third quarter of 2025. Revenues for the third quarter of 2025 under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP") were $1.6 billion, increasing $420 million, or 35.4%, compared to the third quarter of the prior year, with commissions and fees increasing by 34.2% and Organic Revenue increasing by 3.5%. Income before income taxes was $311

headline: Brown & Brown, Inc. Certified by Great Place to Work for seventh consecutive year; included on the 2025 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women list for fifth year
summary: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Oct. 27, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- J. Powell Brown, president and chief executive officer, and Julie Turpin, chief people officer, are proud to announce that Brown & Brown, Inc. (“Brown & Brown”) and our team of U.S. companies have been Certified™ by Great Place to Work® for the seventh consecutive year. Additionally, our companies in Canada and the U.K. have been Certified™ for the first time. Our U.S. companies have also been included on the 2025 Fortune Best Workplaces for
